title: services opening times lavernock spar post office
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityIn March  a post office branch was trialled at SPAR on Brockhill Way in the Lavernock area of Penarth ‚Äì offering basic mail and bill-payment services.Following a review of the trial, the post office will be permanently based here ‚Äì with services to expand, including banking services.It will be open seven days a week, with opening times available at the bottom of this article.Lavernock Post Office now offers the standard range of services that you normally get at a post office.This includes Christmas stamps, Drop  Go for frequent senders and click and collect service to collect parcels from a range of companies. It also includes:‚Ä¢ Mailing services‚Ä¢ Withdrawals,deposits and payments. This includes post office card accounts, personal and business banking, enveloped cheque deposits, barcoded deposit slips, postal orders, Moneygram, automated bill payments and key recharging‚Ä¢ Rod fishing licences‚Ä¢ Travel insurance referrals‚Ä¢ Mobile top-ups and e-vouchers.Lavernock Post Office is not the only one based in Penarth - there is also one based on Glebe Street, with both among more than , branches of the post office across the UK., of these branches are open seven days a week - including Lavernock Post Office - and . per cent of the population in the UK live within three miles of a post office.The opening times for Lavernock Post Office are as follows:Monday: am-pmTuesday: am-pmWednesday: am-pmThursday: am-pmFriday: am-pmSaturday: .am-pmSunday: am-pm.The SPAR which houses Lavernock Post Office is open from am to pm on weekdays, from .am to pm on Saturdays, and from am to pm on Sundays. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: vegan easter eggs marks spencer hotel chocolat
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityLuckily, with more and more people becoming vegan, the selection of vegan Easter treats available is growing.Sweet-toothed vegans can still get their chocolate fix with some of the best vegan eggs available in .Free Soul, a leading wellness and nutrition hub for women, has compiled a list of eight vegan Easter eggs to buy this year.,  px px  rgbamargin: pxmax-width: pxmin-width: pxpadding: width: .%width: -webkit-calcwidth: calc"" fill"#"View this post on Instagram translateY" translateX translateYwidth: .pxflex-grow: margin-right: pxmargin-left: px" translateY" translateY rotate""" translateX"A post shared by Free Soul Reviewers say this is the best vegan chocolate they have tried: "Thick, creamy, delicious chocolate, pure class vegan or not."Another wrote: "Bought these for my family for Easter. Everyone loved the oat-milk chocolate. Customer service excellent."Buy from Hip here.¬†Cutter  Squidge¬†Cookies  Cream Vegan Easter Egg - ¬£.This artisan egg is made up of half a luxurious dark chocolate shell edged in chocolate vermicelli, fit to burst with gorgeous vegan caramel and vegan honeycomb digestive crumb dark chocolate dreambar.The egg is hand-decorated with vegan caramel ganache-filled eggs and crunchy oreo cookies.Buy from Cutter  Squidge hereMade with Hotel Chocolat‚Äôs Nutmilk, the egg is gorgeously creamy and hazelnutty and is satisfyingly thick.The opulent package also includes  irresistible vegan truffles, caramels and pralines, as well as a selection of vegan chocolate mini eggs.Buy from Hotel Chocolat here.¬†,  px px  rgbamargin: pxmax-width: pxmin-width: pxpadding: width: .%width: -webkit-calcwidth: calc"" fill"#"View this post on Instagram translateY" translateX translateYwidth: .pxflex-grow: margin-right: pxmargin-left: px" translateY" translateY rotate""" translateX"A post shared by hotelchocolat Renowned for its vegan chocolates, truffles, and ice creams, the Norfolk-based company has built up a cult following for its bold flavours and quality ingredients.¬†Booja Boojas Easter eggs are hand-painted in a community of artists in Kashmir, India, and make a stunning ornament that can be enjoyed all year round.With small or large eggs available, you can choose from either champagne truffles, hazelnut crunch, or salted caramel..removeBuy from Booja Booja here.¬†Melt Vegan Dark Chocolate Easter Egg - ¬£.Wrapped in ribbon, this ultra-luxurious Vegan Easter egg is crafted from % dark chocolate for a well-balanced bittersweet taste and finished with pretty chocolate drips.Inside, you‚Äôll find flakes of Maldon sea salt, which cut through the rich chocolate perfectly.¬†Buy from Melt here.¬†NOMO Cookie Dough Egg and Bunny - ¬£This egg is perfect not only for vegans but for sufferers of allergies to dairy, gluten, egg or nuts.¬†The eggshell contains puffed rice and cookie dough to give the satisfying added dimension of crunch, and also comes with a cookie dough bunny to satisfy those extra cravings.Buy from NOMO here,  px px  rgbamargin: pxmax-width: pxmin-width: pxpadding: width: .%width: -webkit-calcwidth: calc"" fill"#"View this post on Instagram translateY" translateX translateYwidth: .pxflex-grow: margin-right: pxmargin-left: px" translateY" translateY rotate""" translateX"A post shared by NOMO üç´ This oat milk egg from newcomers Happi is seriously special.Responsibly sourced, lower in sugar than most alternatives and with sustainable packaging, this white chocolate and raspberry egg will satisfy those sweet cravings.¬†Buy from Happi here.¬†Wish someone a happy Easter with our vegan gt bag, featuring our Made Without Dairy Charlie Bunny, festive hot cross buns and indulgent truffles, for a perfect vegan Easter treat.It also comes with¬†plant-based hazelnut chocolate spread,¬†plus a pouch of Colombian coffee and some sparkling apple and pear juice.Buy from Marks and Spencer here.¬† article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - title: revealed number people covid wales now
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityThe Office for National Statisticspublished its regular weekly release analysing results from the COVID- Infection Survey.And, while the overall findings showed a positive trend UK wide, there is some cause for concern in Wales.While new case numbers have been falling ‚Äì according to Public Health Wales , the overall number of covid positive people in Wales might be a lot higher than first thought.At this time, the ONS data estimates that as many as one-in- people in Wales currently have covid.This excludes those in hospitals and care homes, and only considers private households.The ONS estimates that , people in Wales, or . per cent of the population, has covid at this time.It includes all known iants of the potentially deadly virus, with the Omicron BA. iant still the most dominant.In recent days, the PHW figures show that new cases of the virus are more prevalent in Blaenau Gwent and Torfaen than anywhere  in Wales.The ONS study uses the percentage of positive results from tests carried out, to paint a complete picture across Wales, and the rest of the UK.However, it is worth noting that there are fewer tests than ever before being carried out.It comes as a result of free testing coming to an end ‚Äì with only those in healthcare and care settings required to regularly test.What‚Äôs more, symptomatic people or close contacts are no longer required to take a test, which are no longer free.Read more:¬†Latest covid stats for Newport and Wales: Another five deathsRead more:¬†Covid lab blunder could have caused , deathsSarah Crofts, head of analytical outputs for the COVID- infection survey, said: ‚ÄúWhile infections remain high, there are early signs in our latest data that they may no longer be increasing in some parts of the UK..remove"Across English regions, there is a mixed picture in trends and we have seen a welcome decrease in Scotland.¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúHowever, rates in Wales continue to rise and the trend in Northern Ireland is uncertain."It is too early to sayinfections have peaked in England and Scotland. We will continue to monitor the data closely.‚Äù article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: kenny shiels world cup qualification out equation northern ireland
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityThe Green and White Army retain a miniscule chance of overhauling the Lionesses at the top of Group D but are just three points behind second-placed Austria in the battle for a play-off spot with three games to go.However, with minnows Luxembourg, Latvia and North Macedonia providing little competition for the top three, Shiels has thrown in the towel regarding making it to the finals in Australia and New Zealand following Friday‚Äôs - loss away to the Austrians.The -year-old is instead viewing Tuesday‚Äôs game in isolation and says it would be an ‚Äúunbelievable achievement‚Äù to defeat England in front of an expected crowd of around , at Windsor Park in Belfast.‚ÄúThis is not a must-win game because qualication is out of the equation,‚Äù said Shiels.üíö ùïÑùîª-ùüô ùïßùïöùïìùïñùï§ #GAWA #ANewDream pic iUEewjWk‚Äî Northern IrelandApril , ‚ÄúIf we won by five goals, that would be dferent. But we‚Äôre being realistic and we‚Äôre not expecting that to happen.‚ÄúIf we were to beat England, it would be an unbelievable achievement in itself, in isolation to the group.‚ÄùEngland have a  per cent qualying record and are almost certain to top the group after hitting a remarkable  goals without reply.Northern Ireland were beaten - at Wembley back in October having been level until the th minute.They are eight points adrt of the leaders, while last week‚Äôs damaging - defeat in Wiener Neustadt put Austria in pole position to claim the runners-up spot.Shiels‚Äô side complete their campaign away to Luxembourg and Latvia in September but, before then, are scheduled for another meeting with England on their major tournament debut at this summer‚Äôs European Championship. vw,vw,px, px"Captain Marissa Callaghan .removeCaptain Marissa Callaghan says Northern Ireland will take a positive approach against Sarina Wiegman‚Äôs visitors, with one eye on the future.‚ÄúThese are the games you dream about,‚Äù said the -year-old midfielder. ‚ÄúEvery player is looking forward to it and will give it their all.‚ÄúWe have fantastic players in our squad: game changers and goal-scorers. Who knows what can happen ‚ÄúBut the big thing is it‚Äôs going to be great preparation for going forward and we have a lot to look forward to.‚ÄúWe took them on at Wembley, so why not take them on at Windsor  We know England are a fantastic side but so are we.‚ÄúWe go out with a positive attitude, we go out to win games, score goals, defend for our lives, we‚Äôre taking this occasion on. I think it‚Äôs fantastic for the whole country.‚Äù.push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Kenny Shiels: World Cup qualication  uout of the equation u for Northern Ireland article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: scientists crack egg forging evolutionary puzzle
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityThe study suggests birds may inherit their ability to forge the appearance of their hosts‚Äô eggs from their mothers.This mimicry dupes host parents into accepting a parasitic egg as their own rather than throwing it out of the nest.Around the world, many birds sidestep the responsibilities of parenthood by laying their eggs in the nest of other species.While this lestyle, called brood parasitism, has advantages it also presents challenges such as how to convince the other species to accept a foreign egg.Many birds who engage in the practice achieve this by mimicking the colours and patterns of their host‚Äôs eggs.However, some winged animals exploit the care of several dferent host species whose eggs all look dferent.Scientists have long wondered how a single brood-parasitic bird species can do this, and how these forgers can pass this ability on to their young despite interbreeding between birds raised by dferent hosts.Now genetic research by an international team led by Professor Claire Spottiswoode from the University of Cambridge‚Äôs Department of Zoology and the FitzPatrick Institute of African Ornithology, University of Cape Town, and Professor Michael Sorenson at Boston University, has made a major breakthrough, and their findings may be bad news for the egg forgers.The research reveals that female cuckoo finches inherit their ability to mimic the appearance of their hosts‚Äô eggs from their mothers, via the female-specic W chromosome ‚Äì comparable to the male-specic Y chromosome in humans.According to the scientists, this maternal inheritance allows cuckoo finches to sidestep the risk of inheriting the wrong mimicry genes from a father raised by a dferent host.It has also allowed distinct lineages of cuckoo finch females to evolve specialised egg mimicry of several dferent host species..removeThe researchers suggest such mimicry tricks host parents into accepting a parasitic egg as their own rather than throwing it out of the nest, and so has been crucial to the success of these African birds.However, they believe this long-established system of maternal inheritance may come back to haunt the cuckoo finches.Dr Spottiswoode said: ‚ÄúIn this particular coevolutionary arms race between species, natural selection has created a double-edged sword.‚ÄúWhile maternal inheritance has allowed cuckoo finches to exploit multiple host species, it‚Äôs likely to slow their ability to evolve counter-adaptations as their hosts evolve new defences.‚ÄúIn particular, parasites face a daunting challenge because some host species have inevolved an astonishing ersity of egg colour and pattern ‚Äòsignatures‚Äô, that help hosts to distinguish their own eggs from parasitic mimics.‚ÄùThe study, published in PNAS, focused on the genetics of egg mimicry in the cuckoo finch, a species which adopts a brood-parasitic lestyle and exploits many species of warbler across Africa.The data was collected at a study site in southern Zambia.Cuckoo finches in this area trick four dferent species of grass-warbler to devastating effect.If host parents fail to detect and remove a parasitic egg in their nest, the young cuckoo finch typically outcompetes the hosts‚Äô own hatchlings, which soon starve to death.But in their fightback against the forgers, grass-warblers have become skilled quality controllers, rejecting eggs that dfer from their own in colour and pattern, and all four species have evolved the ability to deposit unique signatures onto their own eggs to enhance their detection of intruders.The study argues that selection from host defences drove cuckoo finches to transfer control of egg appearance to the maternally inherited part of the genome at least two million years ago..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Scientists crack egg forging evolutionary puzzle title: lockdown star louis back screen camera installed new osprey nest
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityWoodland Trust Scotland has operated a nest camera each summer since , and the footage became a hit during the first pandemic lockdown, clocking up , views.But Louis moved to a dferent nest last year, leaving fans unable to follow his progress, so technicians installed another camera at his most recent home to catch his every move.It looks like Louis the osprey has arrived at the second nest at #LochArkaigTune in to our #OspreyCam and follow osprey family le unfold this summer! https:t.co UEuTCbtNP@PostcodeLottery https:t.co knYbrUWB‚Äî Woodland Trustüå≥April , Trust spokesman George Anderson said: ‚ÄúLouis landed on nest two this morning and has been busy excavating and rearranging sticks.‚ÄúHe seems to have very definitely chosen to go with the nest he used for the first time last year. Fingers are now crossed for theof his mate, Dorcha.‚ÄùSince a camera was first set up in , funded by players of People‚Äôs Postcode Lottery, it has gained a substantial fanbase of people following the family le of ospreys Louis and Aila as they raised their six chicks.But in  only Louis ed, and he eventually followed a new female to another nest in the forest. As a result, the original camera nest lay empty for most of the summer.Mr Anderson said: ‚ÄúLouis and his new mate Dorcha raised two chicks, so it was a successful year for the ospreys, but a disappointing one for their internet fans.‚ÄúWe wanted to give ourselves the best odds of seeing a full summer of activity this year, so we fitted a second camera to Louis‚Äô new nest.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a few kilometres away from his original tree. Depending on osprey activity, we may revert to follow just one of the nests as the season progresses, butwe are lucky and both nests are occupied, we will keep streaming from both.‚Äù.removeIn the hours after histo the nest, Louis‚Äô mate Dorcha also ed to her Loch Arkaig home.The Trust says that Louis gted his other half a fish upon her .Installing just one camera in the forest is a technical challenge, with no visitor centre nearby with wi-fi and electricity to plug into.All of the camera kits are powered by solar  and a signal is beamed across the loch before it enters the Locheilnet system and goes out across the world..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Lockdown star Louis back on screen after camera installed at new osprey nest article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: easter bring hottest temperatures year far highs c
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityWarm weather is set to continue throughout the week, with dry conditions expected for most of the country ahead of the bank holiday.Met Office meteorologist Annie Shuttleworth said despite the heat, the North West will also experience some lingering cloud, making eastern areas the best destination for sun-seekers over the weekend.‚ÄúIf people are travelling for sunshine, then further eastern areas are more likely to see that brighter weather,‚Äù she said.‚ÄúI think in the main for the bank holiday weekend, we‚Äôll see temperatures quite widely above average across the UK and hopefully they could be very warm in the South East in particular. vw,vw,px, px"The Met Office has said sun-seekers have the best chance of beach-going weather in eastern parts of the UK this weekend ‚ÄúWarmer than average certainly, but nowhere near heatwave criteria.‚ÄúIt will definitely be warmer than the week we‚Äôve just had and last week.‚ÄùIf you havent already heard, its warming up in the run up to #Easter, but just how high will #temperatures climb  üìàFind out in our updated weather for the week ahead üëá pic EfHeVdpP‚Äî Met OfficeApril , The warmest temperature of the year so far has been .C, meaning the highs predicted for the South East on the weekend would set a new record for .‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see temperatures generally come up through the week. Todaywe‚Äôre seeing highs of , then from Thursday onwards temperatures could reach , , quite possibly ,‚Äù she said.‚ÄúAcross southern and eastern areas we‚Äôre more likely to see some sunshine and clearer skies in the afternoon.‚ÄùSome drizzly rain is expected later in the week across the North West along with the cloud, but it is not likely to cause disruption..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Easter could bring hottest temperatures of year so far with highs of up to C article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: sharif sworn pakistans new pm week drama
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityMr Shar took the oath of office inside the stately, white marble palace known as the Presidency in a brief ceremony.But his elevation will not guarantee a peaceful path forward or solve the country‚Äôs many economic problems, including high inflation and a soaring energy crisis. vw,vw,px, px"Imran Khan Mr Shar, the brother of disgraced former prime minister Nawaz Shar, won with  votes after more than  lawmakers from Mr Khan‚Äôs Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, or Pakistan Justice Party, resigned and walked out of the National Assembly in protest.Those  votes ‚Äî two more than the required simple majority ‚Äî are enough to pass laws in the -seat assembly. If Mr Khan‚Äôs followers take to the streets, as he has vowed, it could create more pressure on lawmakers and deepen the crisis.Mr Khan, a former cricket star whose conservative Islamist ideology and dogged independence characterised his three years and eight months in office, was ousted early on Sunday.He lost a no-confidence vote after being deserted by his party allies and a key coalition partner.In a show of strength and a precursor to the political uncertainty ahead, Mr Khan rallied hundreds of thousands of supporters on Sunday night to protest over his ouster, describing the new leadership as an ‚Äúimposed government,‚Äù charging they colluded with the US to oust him.His backers marched in cities across Pakistan, waving large party flags and shouted slogans promising tohim to power. The crowds were dominated by youths who make up the backbone of Mr Khan‚Äôs supporters.The political drama began April  when Mr Khan sidestepped an initial no-confidence vote demanded by the opposition by dissolving parliament and calling early elections.The opposition, which accuses Khan of economic mismanagement, appealed to the Supreme Court. After four days of deliberations, the court said Mr Khan‚Äôs move was illegal and the no-confidence vote went ahead, leading to his ouster..removeMr Khan has demanded early elections ‚Äî the balloting is not due before August . He has tapped into anti-American sentiment in Pakistan, accusing Washington of conspiring with his opponents to topple him. That conspiracy theory resonates with his youthful base, which often sees the US war on terrorism after   as unfairly targeting Pakistan.Mr Khan claims Washington opposes him because of his independent foreign policy favouring China and Russia. He was criticised for a visit he made on February  to Moscow, where he met with President Vladimir Putin as Russian tanks rolled into Ukraine.The US State Department has denied any involvement in Pakistan‚Äôs internal politics..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Shar sworn in as Pakistan us new PM after week of drama article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: no six nations today   find wales play next watch
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communitySimply put the players need a rest. Weeks three and five are typically break weeks during the championship to give the teams times to recuperate.If you are desperate to see how Round  will play out though, you don‚Äôt have long to wait. Games will resume next weekend during the Guinness Six Nations match at the Principality Stadium, Cardf. Picture: PA" alt"Penarth Times: Wales Jac Morgan is tackled by Scotlands Hamish Watson and Duhan van der Merweduring the Guinness Six Nations match at the Principality Stadium, Cardf. Picture: PA" class"editor-image"Wales Jac Morgan is tackled by Scotlands Hamish Watson and Duhan van der Merweduring the Guinness Six Nations match at the Principality Stadium, Cardf. Picture: PA Twickenham Stadium, London‚ÄãSaturday, February .pmNew Wales flanker Jac Morgan admits playing at Twickenham next week would be special given the historic rugby rivalry between England and Wales.Morgan won his first cap on Saturday as reigning Six Nations champions Wales bounced back from a Dublin drubbing against Ireland to beat Scotland - in Cardf.The Welsh-speaking Ospreys openside says he was so nervous before kick-off that he almost forgot the words of the national anthem ‚ÄòHen Wlad Fy Nhadau‚Äô.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always a dream to play for your country from a young age,‚Äù said the -year-old.‚ÄúGrowing up England is one of the biggest games with the rivalry between the two countries over the years.‚ÄúEverybody knows how big the game is with the history between the two sides."Morgan produced an impressive debut display last weekend, as Wales revived their Six Nations title hopes before heading to Twickenham next Saturday.Courtney Lawes has resumed full training in time to reinforce the middle phase of England‚Äôs Guinness Six Nations title push.Lawes was unable to play in the opening two rounds of the tournament because of concussion but has now completed histo play protocols and comes into contention to face Wales next Saturday..removeDefence coach, Anthony Seibold, said: "Courtney trained fully today , which is obviously really good news for himself and England. He looked sharp."Meanwhile, Wasps flanker Jack Willis is set to make his first appearance in a year after finally recovering from the serious knee injury sustained against Italy at Twickenham in the  championship.England v Wales Six Nations:¬†How to watch on TV, live streamThe England v Wales Six Nations match kicks off at .pm on Saturday, February .You can watch coverage on ITV or live stream the game via ITV Hub.Alternatively,you cant make it to a screen, you can also listen live on BBC Radio  Live Sports Extra. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: england v wales six nations   watch itv live stream
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityThe fierce rivals both have title ambitions but neither team can afford any further slip-ups at Twickenham.The competition might only be at the halfway point, but it will effectively be game over for whichever team loses.Both countries lost their opening matches ‚Äì England being defeated by Scotland and Wales suffering an emphatic reversal in Ireland ‚Äì but then put themselves back on track with respective victories over Italy and Scotland.After finishing fth in last season‚Äôs tournament, England know they must kick on towards tough assignments next month against Ireland and France, while Wales‚Äô continued hopes of a successful title defence hinge on the outcome at Twickenham ‚Äì a ground where they have not claimed a Six Nations win since .We‚Äôre here for those unforgettable moments. Download @MatchPint now to find your closest spot for Round @VinegarYardLDN @flatironsquare_ @DepotCardf @freightisland @Pear_Tree_House pic RKsCkVub‚Äî Guinness GBFebruary , The England v Wales¬†Six Nations match kicks off at .pm on Saturday, February .You can watch coverage on ITV from pm or live stream the game via ITV Hub.Alternatively,you cant make it to a screen, you can also listen live¬†on BBC Radio  Live. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log Share s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"  CommentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi lidl middle aisles sunday april
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience ‚Äì the local communityIt is quite often the case that those going in for their usual shopping might come out with an extra item or two.Whether it‚Äôs¬†Aldi‚Äôs Specialbuys¬†or¬†Lidl‚Äôs Middle of Lidl, the latest offers are always worth checking out and there are some fantastic buys from Sunday April .Lets take a look at some of the items you can buy this weekAldi specialbuysAldi often have many products that are perfect for your garden, and this piece might be perfect as a statement piece.The¬†Gardenline Oxidised Fire Globe is on the slightly more expensive side at ¬£.¬†and¬†is described as a "stunning centrepiece" to anyones outdoor space." alt"Penarth Times: Gardenline Oxidised Fire Globe " class"editor-image"Gardenline Oxidised Fire GlobeIt has an intricate bird and leaf laser cut design¬†and can provide a great deal of warmth when it gets cooler in the evenings.You can buy it on the Aldi website hereAnother garden-related item can be found in the¬†Cordless Grass  Hedge Trimmer Shear, which can be bought at the Aldi website for ¬£..It should provide an effective tool in cutting off the edges of hedges, and comes with a battery included.Meanwhile,you want something in your garden for the kids to do as summer begins to roll around, the¬†Plum Junior Trampoline might do the trick.At a cost of ¬£. it can support a maximum weight of around kg and should work fine for small children to bounce around in.Another item that will be fun for the kids is an Inflatable Water Slide, which will be able to fit in your garden." alt"Penarth Times: The inflatable water slide from Aldi " class"editor-image"The inflatable water slide from AldiIt is on the pricier side at ¬£., but it comes with a slide, climb, water cannon and the water pool, and it is very compact to put away.If you fancy owning this for when the summer months come around, then go to the Aldi website here for it.Lidls middle aisleLidl have a number of items this week that are related to the great outdoors as the weather improves and you can go out exploring again..removeIf you plan to go out hiking then these Crivit Walking Boots for ¬£. should provide some sturdy support on your walks." alt"Penarth Times: Crivit Walking Boots " class"editor-image"Crivit Walking BootsAdditionally, Crivit also come in handy with a¬†L Hiking Backpack for ¬£., which has a spacious main compartment plus a holder for a hydration pack and water tubeyou desire it.Crivit actually do a whole range of products specically tailored for those wanting to go camping, such as with this¬†Insulated Drinks Flask for ¬£. and a¬†Pocket Kne   Multial Camping Cutlery¬†for ¬£.¬†to help out with a number of s. article_url title: pastors pen dont worry do something instead
story: Police advise of closure of Lisburn‚Äôs Moira Road    pictures from Lurgan anti-protocol parade and rallyNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsPastor‚Äôs Pen: Don‚Äôt worry! Do something instead‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry!‚Äô How often have we heard that and how often do we say it to others  I suspect it‚Äôs being said quite often at the present time, when there seems to be so much to be worried about, writes Rev. Ron Elsdon.By The NewsroomSunday, rd April , : am  "       "  There‚Äôs the state of the Health Service, the never-ending fallout from Brexit, the war in Ukraine, and the spiralling cost of living which is already inflicting so much hardship on so many. ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry!‚Äô But the problem is that it‚Äôs far easier said than done. So when you come across it in the bible as well, you could be excused for writing it off as unrealistic. Please stay with me for a few moments, however, while I try to explain.        " d"M.,.c-.-.-.-.-.-.c-.-.-.-.,-.c.-.,.-.,.,l.-. c.,.,.,.,.,c.-.,.-.,-.L,.c.,.,.,.,,.C.,.,.,.,.,."   " d"M,.c.,.,.,.,.,.c.,.,.,.,,.c-.,.-.,.-.,l-.,. c-.-.-.-.-.,c-.,.-.,.,,.L.,c-.-.-.-.,-.C.,.,.,.,,."   " d"M.,c.,,.,.,.,.c,.-.,.-.,.S,.,,.C,.,.,,.,"     " fill"#ea"   to our daily NorthernIrelandWorld Today newsletterThe i newsletter cut through the noiseThanks for signing up!Sorry, there seem to be some issues. Please try again later.Submitting...This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.Much of the bible comes from times and situations of great stress and worry, so it‚Äôs not simply saying ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry!‚Äô or offering you a technique like meditation to help you cope. It points you to something rather more than that. I offer you two examples where it offers you responses that are practical ‚Äì strategies,you like.Ron ElsdonFirstly, Paul directs people to pray instead, and to pepper their prayers with thanksgiving . The trouble is that we‚Äôre so good at finding things to complain about, often trivialities, that finding things to give thanks for doesn‚Äôt come easily, even to people who pray regularly, but why not switch course and actually do it, then keep on doing it  Then, says Paul, the protecting peace of God is there to be discovered, even in the midst of stressful situations. Secondly, Jesus talks about worry in the Sermon on the Mount . When it consumes us, he says, what we need is a new set of ambitions which point us beyond ourselves ‚ÄúSeek first God‚Äôs kingdom and God‚Äôs righteousness‚Äù is His command to His followers. As I write, I‚Äôm thinking about a local politician, one I shan‚Äôt be voting for. I know he spends Christmas Day at a place for the homeless, helping to serve up hot meals for that I admire him greatly. As I write, hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are fleeing the army of a tyrant from the east, many with nowhere to go in freezing weather. In neighbouring countries, churches and other organisations are swinging into action to help support these folk in their hour of desperate need. So, in their dferent ways, Jesus‚Äô and Paul‚Äôs words in the bible are saying to us all, ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt worry! Do something instead.‚ÄôRead: Covid travel requirement set to change

title: wit wisdom this too shall pass
story: Fuel costs: NI‚Äôs most expensive and cheapest petrol and diesel prices   Toome road tragedy: woman dies after crash and man is arrestedNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsAdam Harbinson. WIT  WISDOM: This too shall passWith our recent fine weather I‚Äôve been doing more than my usual five-to- miles a day walking, an activity that, with many of my countrymen, I developed during the lockdown, when there was little  to do, writes Adam Harbinson.By The NewsroomSunday, th April , : am  "       "  Last week was idyllic as I walked along the Donegal coast from Moville to Greencastle it was magical, and it struck me again, that while we all know the value of regular exercise, fresh air and social engagement, we might never really know just how beneficial such days are for our physical and mental health.But what perhaps, on the flipside, will our memories of - be in  years time  We‚Äôll be asking ourselves, how on Earth did we remain sane  Brexit has wreaked havoc on our economy, piled on top of which was Covid-. I can still feel the cloud of gloom that settled on me when a radio announcer was suggesting that all over s would not be allowed outside the door of their homes for  weeks.Thankfully it didn‚Äôt quite come to that.Then came the murderous war in Ukraine, with pictures being flashed onto our screens of European families hiding in cellars in fear or their lives, not to mention the bloody carnage. But how does this bad news affect our mental health To further exacerbate my potential for anxiety I can tell you that five of my close friends and family members are suffering from le-threatening health problems one has even invited me to his rd birthday party, when he and I know full well that in reality it‚Äôs a ‚Äògoing away‚Äô party. I‚Äôm in my mid-s and while I feel as mentally and physically fit as I was in my s, the thing I hate about my age is that so many of my contemporaries are dropping like flies.So, what can we do to protect ourselves  Firstly we must regulate our intake of deadly news regular exercise and getting out into the countryside is helpful too. Gratitude is of vital importance, so let‚Äôs get a pen and paper and make a list of the many aspects of our lives for which we can be truly grateful.But is that enough  You might say no, but since there might be little we can do to help our suffering brothers and sisters, we must recognise the need for serenity to accept the things we cannot change and thecourage to change the things we can.One thing‚Äôs for sure this too will pass. Read more from Adam at www.adamharbinsonbooks Read: Covid- spring booster who is eligible to get it

title: muckamore wi branch out to save the world
story: Curry‚Äôs Fun Park Portrush announce new rides, tokens and appeal for staff   Toome road tragedy: woman dies after crash and man is arrestedNewsCoronavirusTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsHealthBusinessEducationPeopleEnvironmentRead ThisUkraine CrisisFootballIrish League FootballSportMotorcyclingIce HockeyOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleFood and DrinkTravelHomes and GardensCars FamilyYour NIRetroOpinionAdvertise My Businesscanonical_urlCANONICAL_URLhostnameCANONICAL_HOSTNAMElocationCANONICAL_URLreferrerEXTERNAL_REFERRERpage_view_id_PAGE_VIEW_ID_scroll_SCROLL_HEIGHTgeo__INJECT_GEO__cid_ga:CLIENT_ID,comScore:CLIENT_ID,compass_uid:CLIENT_IDversionsha-wJFtySqNnAxBmRbBZGkmXyZeJTYkxlpMdJsFNIrrGVlru-DcIEIZ" class"i-amphtml-layout-container" i-amphtml-layout"container"Loading...NewsPeopleMuckamore WI branch out to save the worldMembers of Muckamore WI have been embracing a long-term project to help the fight against climate change which was started by members of Home and Garden Committee of the Women‚Äôs Institute of Northern Ireland to mark and celebrate the Women‚Äôs Institute‚Äôs th anniversary.By Elinor GlynnMonday, th April , : pm  "       "  The ‚ÄòPlant a tree‚Äô project was launched in August  and, to date, over  trees have been distributed to all Institutes in N.I. Together with the Woodland Trust, the Federation has taken on an important challenge to build a better, greener environment for now and the future. Muckamore WI ladies are embracing this scheme in their ‚Äò Steps to Wellbeing‚Äô initiative and this has seen over  ladies planting a tree on their premises as part of the fight against climate change after they received saplings, including as Crab Apple, Hazel, Rowan, Silverbirch and Wild Cherry. title: curry s fun park opens in portrush
story: AFTER months of waiting, Currys Fun Park in Portrush is finally open! The eagerly anticipated successor to the popular Barrys Amusements opened its doors for the first time on Saturday amid great excitement. Hundreds of people young and old filed through the doors all afternoon as the magic ed to Portmagic - and just in time for Easter. The good news is that Currys is now up and running, boasting all the old Barrys favourites and adding some new ones too. And for those with old Barrys tokens - no, you cant use them, but you can help the RNLI by dropping them into collection boxes dotted around the complex. The fun park has chosen the charity as its partner - a thoughtful gesture given the important work volunteers do in the waters off the north coast. But for now, after two years of zero craic because of the pandemic, all roads lead to the Port and what promises to be a fun-filled holiday period. Happy days.  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:     , ,, , ,  .jsp, , ,   , ,success:  ,  n n nHome n n nNews n n nCommunity Lestyle n n nNews n n nGallery n n n n nSport n n nFootball n n nGAA n n nRugby n n nGolf n n nMotor Sports n n nOther n n n n nMotors n n n " Jobs n n n " Classieds n n n " Book an ad n n n " View an ad n n n n n " Announcements n n n " Book an announcement n n n " View an announcement n n n n nGallery n n n " Book an ad n n n " Order your photos n n n " Advertise with us n n nOther titles n n n " Antrim  n n n " Ballycastle Chronicle n n n " Ballymena  n n n " Ballymoney Chronicle n n n " Coleraine Chronicle n n n " County Down Outlook n n n " Limavady Northern Constitution n n n " Newry Democrat n n n " Strabane Weekly News n n n " Tyrone Courier n n n " Ulster Gazette n n n n nHome Delivery n n nDigital Paper n n n n n n bannerbox_faadcbdcbdaebed   n n. n n n n .remove n n n n n n n" .html.html  n n nHome n n nNews n n nCommunity Lestyle n n nNews n n nGallery n n n n nSport n n nFootball n n nGAA n n nRugby n n nGolf n n nMotor Sports n n nOther n n n n nMotors n n n " Jobs n n n " Classieds n n n " Book an ad n n n " View an ad n n n n n " Announcements n n n " Book an announcement n n n " View an announcement n n n n nGallery n n nOther titles n n n " Antrim  n n n " Ballycastle Chronicle n n n " Ballymena  n n n " Ballymoney Chronicle n n n " Coleraine Chronicle n n n " County Down Outlook n n n " Limavady Northern Constitution n n n " Newry Democrat n n n " Strabane Weekly News n n n " Tyrone Courier n n n " Ulster Gazette n n n n nHome Delivery n n nDigital Paper n n n n n n bannerbox_faddedfcbcfe   n n. n n n n .remove n n n n n n n" .html.html .  ,.vc_most_readMost Popular Stories.   , ]]      []js  d js.id  idjs.src  "connect.facebook.net en_US #xfbmlversionv."fjs[],p ^http: .test http:httpsjs+: fjspo  text javascript   truepo.src  https:apis.google js plusone.js s  document[] s

title: familiar faces on this week s rare breed
story: UTV‚Äôs hit farming series, ‚ÄòRare Breed - A Farming Year‚Äô, s on Tuesday th April at pm. The families are bringing in their ious harvests and making preparations for next year. It‚Äôs October, and on the shores of Strangford Lough the Elliott family rear turkeys. The family have years of experience looking after the birds and yet Mark and Olive are still fascinated by their behaviour. Olive comments that they are ‚Äòextremely inquisitive‚Äô. While Mark is making sure the turkeys are well fed, his mum Olive can‚Äôt help giving them an extra treat. She comments too, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt do without my family, I have to be so nice to them at the minute!‚Äù Mark points out that they have been receiving orders for Christmas since August, which is ‚Äòabsolutely nuts.‚Äô Near Kilcoo in the Mourne Mountains, Aine Devlin is preparing her flock for the most critical part of her farming year- breeding season. Aine is keeping an eye on her rams to make sure they‚Äôre doing their job. She coats their chests with paint to see which ewes they have been with. Aine laughs, ‚ÄúThis is his cologne for the girls!‚Äù For her AI is not the way to go as the ewes would then all lamb on the same day on the mountain. She loves this time of year and is proud of the part she plays in the economy. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs better than buying produce from down the road from your neighbours and local communities ‚Äù she says. Outside Crossgar, Richard Orr is thinking ahead to next year‚Äôs wheat crop. It‚Äôs all about the planning and attention to detail to make sure the groundwork is done right. He‚Äôs conscious of the environment, saying, ‚ÄúThe major thing in the world is carbon footprint. Chemicals have made farming easy, and modern machinery has damaged the structure of the soil - we need to rebuild that.‚Äù Meanwhile, just outside Portadown it‚Äôs all hands on deck for apple harvest at the McKeever family farm. There isn‚Äôt a high yield this year but sometimes things not going to plan can be a blessing. Pat talks about the seven to eight weeks of hell and this year pickers have been hard to get. Peter comments, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs half the battle when you have good people around.‚Äù On the Donegal   Londonderry border, potato farmer Jamie Rankin and his team are coming towards the end of their harvest. He enjoys the early starts and says, ‚ÄúWhat you do before dinner time‚Äôs your day‚Äôs work.‚Äù While it‚Äôs a job Jamie enjoys, it also comes with challenges as winter months close in. The bad weather has led to reduced yields and a late harvest, but he‚Äôs very proud to have produced a good crop. UTV‚Äôs Mark McFadden narrates the series. Sponsored by Moy Park, ‚ÄòRare Breed ‚Äì A Farming Year‚Äô continues on Tuesday th April at pm on UTV.  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:     , ,, , , title: april showers keep them shorter
story: Spring has finally sprung and with rising energy costs there is no better time to dust off old habits and create some new ones that are good for your pocket and the environment. Start by thinking how much water you are using each day. Whether you are washing your hands, cleaning endless amounts of dishes or getting through that mountain of washing, you start to realise just how important water is and the sheer amount we use. NI Water‚Äôs Environmental Outreach  Learning Officer, Anna Killen, explains how we can save water by looking at everyday habits, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs amazing to think that each day each person uses around  litres of water! However, saving water can be really easy, there are simple things we can all do that can make a huge dference. ‚ÄúDid you know that the average time people in Northern Ireland spend in the shower is  minutes, over % of people still overfill the kettle and less than frac of people have a waterbutt ‚Äù  ‚ÄúWe want that to change and it‚Äôs easy, start by looking at small changes for example, your kettle, since working from home it has have been working overtime, but just fill with as much water as you need. Overfilling can use twice as much energy and water, each time you boil. ‚ÄúWith rising energy costs, it might be time to think about reducing the time spent in the shower, hot water costs money! Why not try the  minute shower challenge, put on your favourite  minute song and seeyou can finish before the end.‚Äù To help you embed with these new habits and ‚ÄòGet Water Fit‚Äô, complete our online water audit at https:www.getwaterfit or take part in water saving challenges and receive your free water saving items including  minute shower timer, toothy timers and swell gel bags for the garden. Some water saving tips:  Turn off the tap when brushing your teeth - A running tap can use  litres ofwater per minute.  Use a bowl for washing vegetables - Then you can reuse this water for plants.  Make full use of your washing machine - Half load programmes on washing machines use more than half the water and energy of a full load, so wait until the machine is full before switching it on.  Fix leaking taps - A dripping tap can waste more than  litres of water per week.  Keep a jug of water in the fridge, instead of letting the tap run cold. NI Water are encouraging customers to sign up to its free text alert service which keeps them updated about anything that may impact on their water supply or any of our other services in the area.here
